poem:
**Solo Dwellings**

In silent flats and one-room hums,  
where echoes only know one name,  
and kettle steam curls through  
empty conversations,  
a single plate sits drying  
under unpaired forks.  
Nothing terrifying—just the art  
of turning solitary walls to whispers,  
where one heart learns  
the choreography of its own rhythm.
